thread.title: Westworld's Angela Sarafyan goes commando in Hollywood | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Westworld's Angela Sarafyan goes commando in Hollywood | Daily Mail Online

author: Ryan Smith For Mailonline
title: Westworld's Angela Sarafyan goes commando in Hollywood | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Letting her gown do all of the talking, she opted to go minimal on the accessories, enhancing her look with just a pair of glittering stud earrings. Her lustrous raven tresses cascaded down her back, while her makeup palette included deep pink lipstick and a smudge of smoky eye shadow. Are you sheer about that? She arrived in a white gown, which featured sheer side panels Minimal: She let her dress do all of the talking, going minimal on the accessories on the night Dakota Johnson and Vanity Fair executive West Coast editor Krista Smith co-hosted the event, whose guests included Ariel Winter, Ashley Madekwe and Victoria Justice. The evening was in support of The Roar Foundation Shambala Preserve, which is an animal sanctuary that was established in 1972. Campaign Hollywood is a series of events that take place the week before the Oscars to raise money and awareness for different charities. Pretty in pink: Earlier in the day, she uploaded a shot of herself in a billowing pink gown Brew: She also enjoyed a warm beverage at a local eatery as she prepared for her big night out In a recent interview with Refinery29 , Angela - who has appeared on such shows as American Horror Story and Buffy The Vampire Slayer - revealed that she 'got goosebumps' when she first read a script for Westworld. She said: 'I didn’t really know anything about it, and only three pages of lines were sent to me as an audition. But when I looked at them, I got goosebumps. 'It was like nothing I ever auditioned for, and it was some of the best writing I ever read, like beautiful poetry — Gertrude Stein, Edgar Allan Poe, or a line of Shakespeare. 'I read it over and over and over in the middle of the night, thinking, "What is this?"' Big success: The screen star is enjoying success in the new HBO hit series Westworld, in which she portrays altruistic robot prostitute Clementine Pennyfeather Co-star: She stars alongside British actress Thandie Newton, who plays madam Maeve Millay
